data: ANES Patient Controlled Epidural Analgesia PCEA (Surgical) (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Restricted to Department of Anesthesiology
Admit to Acute Pain Service (APS) / Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) / Anesthesiology - See ANES Multi-Modal Pain Management PowerPlan
Patient Care
Communication Order

Do NOT give any Opioids, CNS depressants and other analgesics unless approved by the Acute Pain Service (APS) / Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) / Anesthesiology (EXCEPT in Critical Care Units: CSICU and ICU)
Communication Order
Epidural/perineural contraindicated if dose exceeds: enoxaparin 40 mg daily or dalteparin 5000 units daily or heparin 5000 units q8h
Communication Order
For patients receiving prophylactic subcutaneous enoxaparin up to 40 mg qdaily or dalteparin up to 5000 units qdaily or heparin up to 5000 units q8h
Notify Treating Provider
If inadequate analgesia or other problems with epidural catheter
Notify Treating Provider Vital Signs
SBP less than 90 mmHg, HR less than 45 bpm, or postural BP drop greater than 15 mmHg,  HR increases by 20 bpm
Peripheral IV Care
Maintain IV access for 24 hours after epidural infusion stopped
Respiratory Rate
If Respiratory Rate is 8/min or less:
Sedation Assessment
If Sedation Score (POSS) 3 or greater:
Monitoring Orders are for Inpatient Ward
Upon initiation of epidural infusion:
Vital Signs
q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour , then q4h and PRN
Pulse Oximetry
q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour , then q4h and PRN
Sedation Assessment
q1h for 12 hour, then q2h for 12 hour, then q4h and PRN
Pain Assessment
q1h for 12 hour, then q2h for 12 hour, then q4h and PRN
Motorsensory Assessment
q12h and PRN dermatome assessment with ice. q4h motor assessment while awake
Local Anesthetic Toxicity Assessment
Assess for systemic side effects of local anesthetic q4h while awake
Orthostatic Vital Signs
Postural BP and pulse prior to first ambulation
Bladder Scan
q6h while awake, for bladder distention if not catheterized
ANES Epidural Discontinuation (Module)
None
Medications

Some solutions are Pharmacy Custom solutions and may not be available at all sites or after-hours (after 23:00).  Please follow local site protocols and ensure adequate time for custom solution preparation

Respiratory
Oxygen Therapy
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater, Nasal Cannula, for 48 hour, 2-4 L/min via nasal prongs except when patient is ambulating
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 88 - 92 %, Nasal Cannula, for 48 hour, for known/suspected CO2 retainers; 2-4 L/min via nasal prongs except when patient is ambulating
Oxygen Therapy
10 L/min if naloxone administered
